alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Custer County through 100 AM CDT... At 1230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ansley, or 17 miles east of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Comstock, Westerville, Big Oak Canyon, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Gavin Siding and Wescott. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 87 and 105. Highway 2 between mile markers 289 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
